intro: Megalastrum platylobum, commonly known as the broadleaf megalastrum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
